DataElement.preferredDefinition: The extent of the diffusion or accumulation of radionuclide imaging agent in tissue or cells.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Procedure Agents Domain Radionuclide Imaging Agent Infiltration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to agents used as part of a procedure._An imaging technique that uses a small dose of a radioactive chemical (isotope) called a tracer that can detect sites of cancer growth, trauma, infection or degenerative disorders. The tracer, which is either injected into a vein or swallowed, travels through the bloodstream to the target organ, and emits gamma rays, which are detected by a gamma camera and analyzed by a computer to form an image of the target organ._An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect._The process of the diffusion or accumulation in a tissue or cells of a substance not normal to it or in amounts above normal. (NCI)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to agents used as part of a procedure.

Property.preferredDefinition: An imaging technique that uses a small dose of a radioactive chemical (isotope) called a tracer that can detect sites of cancer growth, trauma, infection or degenerative disorders. The tracer, which is either injected into a vein or swallowed, travels through the bloodstream to the target organ, and emits gamma rays, which are detected by a gamma camera and analyzed by a computer to form an image of the target organ.:An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.:The process of the diffusion or accumulation in a tissue or cells of a substance not normal to it or in amounts above normal. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: An imaging technique that uses a small dose of a radioactive chemical (isotope) called a tracer that can detect sites of cancer growth, trauma, infection or degenerative disorders. The tracer, which is either injected into a vein or swallowed, travels through the bloodstream to the target organ, and emits gamma rays, which are detected by a gamma camera and analyzed by a computer to form an image of the target organ.
An active power or cause (as principle, substance, physical or biological factor, etc.) that produces a specific effect.
The process of the diffusion or accumulation in a tissue or cells of a substance not normal to it or in amounts above normal. (NCI)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A subdivision which indicates the diffusion or accumulation in tissue or cells of substances not normal to it.  [Manually-curated]

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Minor infiltration is estimated to be less than  or equal to 20% of dose

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Severe infiltration is estimated to be more than 20% of dose

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The diffusion or accumulation in a tissue or cells of substances not normal to it or in amounts above normal.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: The process of the diffusion or accumulation in a tissue or cells of a substance not normal to it or in amounts above normal. (NCI)
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/24/12 VD versioned; max length increased to accommodate Infiltration Type names. Removed CSI reference to caBIG-ACRIN-PET CDE. jc  3/5/08 - released for UoWASH FES CRF.  12/20/07 revised to generize to more than radiotracer infiltration which is captured in the DEC.  10/3/07 - created to support ACRIN PET CDE curation
